one who is always asking for things
one who keeps dropping things here and there
to have abundant leaves and branches

to be in large group (esp. cows, or people sitting)
long hair (with butter and mud in it)
poison of snake or other animal (in mouth)
to cooperate in getting a job done quickly

to put on a roof for
to look at without paying attention
to do something that causes pleasure or amazement
to declare one's case at a trial

small trees with fronds resembling palms
to be found in possession of
to give to another to share
"medicine" people rub on to make others like them
to take to someone where he is
to talk or act foolishly, as a crazy person
to be scratched (as cooking pot with design)
to burst open in garden (as overripe beans)
kugwira isari - to fall (faint) from hunger
to put design on pot, basket
to stay at the king's court for a time (or a great chief's)
gusasa i bgami - to go to work for chief or king
gu-sasa (shashe) amahembe - to be many together (cows)
to have many children when one is the last of the family
to spread grass around something (e.g. around coffee trees)
to beat drum continuously, thus setting time for others beating
to praise highly one of whom you've heard
to go to help another in his work
to rejoice in the coming of another
to gather up grass that has been spread out
populous tribe or clan (and therefore strong)
word that remains in heart causing sorrow or anger
piece of something that has been cut
giving up after trying several times
to become barren (from lack of fertilizer)
to tattle (in order to advance oneself)
splashing of water in river or lake on rocks
to crowd up together (people sitting on floor)
to carry and put down frequently
to ram into as a sheep does
to shell or grind in wooden mortar

to call from hill to hill
sparks or coals that go up with the smoke
child of one's brother (if "one" is a girl)

to have something penetrate the skin
to be hurt by what someone says
to fix up nice place to sit
to prepare a place to sit for
familiar term for addressing another (used mostly by men and boys)
to ripen (for certain fruits, esp. bananas)
big strong reed, stalk of Kaffir corn
to get rutted or pitted from rain

beer or milk with water mixed in
to be cross at, because of
to try to get out of work
to appear as working but really doing nothing

to go to chief with trouble, complaint

pl. inshi - slaps on the face

one who stands erect, on guard
to prop (something on ground, not high up)
to cause or enable to hold up
to jump when stung or bit

to be accompanied to wedding (as bride is)
to grit one's teeth to avoid showing pain
to grit one's teeth to a void crying out in pain

ijoro rishira ubuca - night is almost over, about to dawn
to rub to keep from swelling
to run out bit by bit till all gone
to not quit without accomplishing a certain thing
to be, convinced after proof or persuasion
to be flourishing (of growing things, child)
to tie beans to hedge to dry
to verify what one has heard by asking many
to be nauseated by repulsive thing

fearlessness (because one knows he is right)
to do quickly (esp. used by Batwa)

to fall or jump from above

umusi ur'izina - on a certain day

illness where abdomen swells and fills with fluid
to do or answer quickly without thinking
illness where abdomen swells and fills with fluid

to destroy the work of another
long thing (esp. stalk of bananas, etc.)
spears on big reeds and grasses

to be of the flavor of
